@description: Atomic unit of time is time unit, symbol: [au]. Definition of 1 atomic unit of time ≡ a0/(α·c). This is the smallest meaningful time unit under which an electron takes a circle on the first Bohr pitch divided by 2π..
Blink is time unit. Definition of 1 blink ≡ 0.25 s. Human blink duration ranges from 0.1 to 0.4 seconds. Blink time is calculated as average of this range, and this value is a quarter of a second..
Callippic cycle is time unit. Definition of 1 Callippic cycle ≡ 76 years (Julian). One callippic cycle is equal to 441 mo (hollow) + 499 mo (full) ≡ 76 a of 365.25 d ≡ 2.3983776 Gs.
Century is time unit, symbol: [c]. Definition of 1 century ≡ 100 years (Gregorian). ≡ 365.2425 × 100 × 86400 seconds.

Day is time unit, symbol: [d]. Definition of 1 day ≡ 24 h ≡ 1440 min. One day (solar day) is period of time from noon to noon ≡ 24 hours. A solar day is the time it takes for the Earth to rotate about its axis so that the Sun appears in the same position in the sky. 24 [h] × 3600 [s] ≡ 86.4 [ks] ≡ 86400 [s].

Day (sidereal) is time unit, symbol: [d (sidereal)]. Definition of 1 day (sidereal) ≡ 23 h, 56 min, 4.0916 sec. A sidereal day is the time needed for the Earth to rotate once around its axis so that the distant stars appear in the same position in the sky. This is ~4 minutes shorter than the solar day..
Decade is time unit, symbol: [dec]. Definition of 1 decade ≡ 10 years (Gregorian). ≡ 365.2425 × 10 × 86400 seconds.
Fortnight is time unit, symbol: [fn]. Definition of 1 fortnight ≡ 2 wk. A fortnight is a unit of time equal to 14 days (2 weeks) ≡ fourteen nights.
Gigaseconds is time unit, symbol: [Gs]. Definition of 1 gigaseconds ≡ 10^9 s. one billion seconds.
Helek is Hebrew time unit. Definition of 1 helek ≡ 1⁄1080 h. The helek (or chelek) is a unit of time used in the calculation of the Hebrew calendar. 3600 s / 1080.

Hipparchic cycle is time unit. Definition of 1 Hipparchic cycle ≡ 4 Callippic cycles - 1 d. A lunar cycle noticed by Hipparchus. Eric Weisstein's World of Biography It consists of four Callipic cycles less a day, in which (4 × 27759 - 1) days are very nearly 3760 months, ≡ 9.593424 Gs.
Hour is time unit, symbol: [h]. Definition of 1 hour ≡ 60 min. One hour is a time required for minute hand on analog clock to create a circle ≡ 3.6 ks.
Jiffy is time unit, symbol: [j]. Definition of 1 jiffy ≡ 1⁄60 s. Jiffy is an informal term for any unspecified short period of time. Common 1/60 s (alternative 1/100 s).
Ke is Chinese time unit. Definition of 1 ke ≡ 1⁄100 d ≡ 14.4 min. Traditional ke is unit of time in the traditional time system in ancient China. ≡ 14.4 min ≡ 14 min, 24 sec ≡ 864 s.
Kiloseconds is time unit, symbol: [ks]. Definition of 1 kiloseconds ≡ 10^3 s. a thousand times of a second.
"<b>Lustre
column10: lustrum is time unit. Definition of 1 lustre
column11: lustrum ≡ 5 years (of 365 d). A lustre is a period of five years. Its use dates back to Ancient Rome, when a lustrum was a five-year period at the end of which a full census of the Roman population would be carried out. ≡ 5*365*86400 ≡ 157.68 Ms."

@description: "<b>Lustre
column10: lustrum is time unit. Definition of 1 lustre
column11: lustrum ≡ 5 years (of 365 d). A lustre is a period of five years. Its use dates back to Ancient Rome, when a lustrum was a five-year period at the end of which a full census of the Roman population would be carried out. ≡ 5*365*86400 ≡ 157.68 Ms."

@description: Megaseconds is time unit, symbol: [Ms]. Definition of 1 megaseconds ≡ 10^6 s. one million seconds.
"<b>Metonic cycle
column10: enneadecaeteris is time unit. Definition of 1 Metonic cycle
column11: enneadecaeteris ≡ 6940 d. For astronomy and calendar studies, the Metonic cycle or Enneadecaeteris is a period of very close to 19 years that is nearly a common multiple of the solar year and the synodic month. ≡ 110 mo (hollow) + 125 mo (full) ≡ 6940 d ≡ 19 a ≡ 599.616 Ms."

@description: "<b>Metonic cycle
column10: enneadecaeteris is time unit. Definition of 1 Metonic cycle
column11: enneadecaeteris ≡ 6940 d. For astronomy and calendar studies, the Metonic cycle or Enneadecaeteris is a period of very close to 19 years that is nearly a common multiple of the solar year and the synodic month. ≡ 110 mo (hollow) + 125 mo (full) ≡ 6940 d ≡ 19 a ≡ 599.616 Ms."

@description: Microsecond is time unit, symbol: [µs]. Definition of 1 microsecond ≡ 10^-6 s. millionth part of a second.
Millennium is time unit. Definition of 1 millennium ≡ 1000 years (Gregorian). A thousand Gregorian years ≡ 365.2425 × 1000 × 86400 s ≡ 31.556952 Gs.
Milliday is time unit, symbol: [md]. Definition of 1 milliday ≡ 1⁄1000 d. One thousandth of a day ≡ 86400/1000.
Millisecond is time unit, symbol: [ms]. Definition of 1 millisecond ≡ 0.001 s. thousandth of second.
Minute is time unit, symbol: [min]. Definition of 1 minute ≡ 60 s. One minute is a time equal to rotation time of sweep (or second) hand at analog clock ≡ 60 s.
Moment is time unit. Definition of 1 moment ≡ 90 s. Time unit used in the Middle Ages. 1 hour on sundial was divided into 40 parts ≡ moments. 3600/40 ≡ 90 s.
Month (full) is time unit, symbol: [mo]. Definition of 1 month (full) ≡ 30 d. Full month ≡ 30 days × 86400 sec..

Month (Gregorian average) is time unit, symbol: [mo]. Definition of 1 month (Gregorian average) ≡ 30.436875 d. Average Gregorian month is calculated from average Gregorian Year divided by 12 month: 365.2425 days / 12 months × 86400 sec ≡ 2.6297 Ms.
Month (hollow) is time unit, symbol: [mo]. Definition of 1 month (hollow) ≡ 29 d. Hollow month ≡ 29 days × 86400 sec..

"Month (sidereal) is time unit. Definition of 1 month (sidereal) ≡ 27.321661 days. It is the time it takes the Moon to go around Earth measured from a fixed point. Sideric month is not completely constant, an average value has been used for calculating. ."

Month (synodic) is time unit, symbol: [mo]. Definition of 1 month (synodic) ≡ 29.530589 days. Synodic month ≡ Cycle time of moon phases (example, from fool moon to next fool moon). This period is not constant and it is longer than moon rotation around Earth (sidereal month), because moon and Earth moves together around the Sun..
Nanoseconds is time unit, symbol: [ns]. Definition of 1 nanoseconds ≡ 10^-9 s. billionth part or a second.

Octaeteris is time unit. Definition of 1 octaeteris ≡ 2922 d. In astronomy, an octaeteris is the period of eight solar years after which the moon phase occurs on the same day of the year plus one or two days. ≡ 48 mo (full) + 48 mo (hollow) + 3 mo (full) ≡ 8 a of 365.25 d ≡ 2922 d ≡ 252.4608 Ms.
Planck time is time unit. Definition of 1 Planck time ≡ ( Gℏ⁄c5) 1⁄2. It is the time required for light to travel in a vacuum a distance of 1 Planck length, approximately 5.39 × 10^-44 s..

Second is metric time unit, symbol: [s]. Definition of 1 second ≡ 1 s. SI base unit. The second is the duration of 9 192 631 770 periods of the radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the cesium 133 atom at 0 K temperature..

Shake is time unit. Definition of 1 shake ≡ 10^-8 s. A shake is an informal unit of time equal to 10 nanoseconds (ns), or 10^-8 seconds. It has applications in nuclear physics, helping to conveniently express the timing of various events in a nuclear explosion..
Sigma is time unit. Definition of 1 sigma ≡ 10^-6 s. Unit of time equal to one microsecond (1 μs) or 10^-6 seconds..

Sothic cycle is time unit. Definition of 1 Sothic cycle ≡ 1461 a of 365 d. The Sothic cycle or Canicular period is a period of 1,461 Egyptian civil years of 365 days each or 1,460 Julian years (365.25 days each) ≡ 1461×365×86400 [s] ≡ 46.074096 [Gs].
"Svedberg is time unit, symbol: [S]. Definition of 1 svedberg ≡ 10^-13 s. The svedberg is actually a measure of time
column10: it is defined as exactly 10^-13 seconds (100 fs). It is often used to reflect the rate at which a molecule travels to the bottom of a test tube under the centrifugal force of a centrifuge.."

@description: Teraseconds is time unit, symbol: [Ts]. Definition of 1 teraseconds ≡ 10^12 s. a trillion-seconds.

@definition: . Week is a period of seven consecutive days (calendar week usually
@description: Week is time unit, symbol: [wk]. Definition of 1 week ≡ 7 d ≡ 168 h ≡ 10080 min. Week is a period of seven consecutive days (calendar week usually starts on Sunday in North America or Monday in Europe). One week consists seven days or 168 hours..
Year (common) is time unit, symbol: [a, y, or yr]. Definition of 1 year (common) 365 d. The year commonly has 365 days (except the leap year).

Year (Gregorian) is time unit, symbol: [a, y, or yr]. Definition of 1 year (Gregorian) ≡ 365.2425 d average. As the common year has 365 days, the Gregorian calendar with leap years compensate the deviation from the real, astronomical year. According to this calendar, every 4th year is a leap year, except for every 100th. But every 400th is a leap year. This means that there are 97 leap years in 400 year period. So according to Gregorian's calendar, one year has 365 + 97/400 days (average). This is not a perfect approach, but in 1000 year period, the defiation is only 0.3 days compared to the astronomical year. In the year 1582 Gregorian replaced the Julian calendar..

Year (Julian) is time unit, symbol: [a, y, or yr]. Definition of 1 year (Julian) ≡ 365.25 d average. The basic calendar year has 365 days, but in fact the Earth needs a little more time around the sun. The Julian calendar compensated this with leap year (every fourth year had 366 days). According to the formula, a Julian year has 365 + 1/4 ≡ 365.25 days. But even with this compensation, the astronomical year slip 0.78 days every 100 years into real seasons. Therefore, most countries have moved to the Gregorian calendar introduced in 1582..

Year (leap) is time unit, symbol: [a, y, or yr]. Definition of 1 year (leap) ≡ 366 d. Leap year has 366 days. The role of leap year is to compensate difference from astronomical- and common calendar year..

Year (mean tropical) is time unit, symbol: [a, y, or yr]. Definition of 1 year (mean tropical) ≡ 365.242190402 d. Tropical year is the length of time it takes for the Sun to return to the same position in the cycle of seasons, approximately 365.24219 days.

Year (sidereal) is time unit, symbol: [a, y, or yr]. Definition of 1 year (sidereal) ≡ 365.256363004 d. Sidereal year is a time taken for Sun to return to the same position with respect to the stars of the celestial sphere, approximately 365.256363 days..
